Articles.Content:
Boy, do I hope that there is some kind of analog to Kepler 1520b (henceforth refered to as k1520b) in ksp 2, k1520b is a real life exoplanet orbiting so close to its star, it is evaporating, (or to be precise, sublimating), we think it has already lost 70% of it’s mass, all that’s left is the iron core, much like Charr was described by Nate Simpson. Even if it is another planet than Charr I would love a k1520b analog. Very challenging to explore, pretty much entirely due to heat, k1520b has less mass than the moon.   

Sorry, I probably should have put this in the discussion thread and not the suggestions one.

Edited July 29, 2021 by Hyperspace Industries
Wrong place in forum, too lazy to fix.
